items.title: 'Ferrari are the obvious target' | Could Bearman be a future Hamilton replacement?
items.summary: Oliver Bearman discusses his ambition to one day be in a Ferrari seat, but admits he's 'just getting started' with Haas.

items.title: Valente nog lang niet klaar in Rotterdam: 'Ik kan nog veel beter'
items.summary: Luciano Valente maakte deze zomer de overstap van FC Groningen naar Feyenoord. In een mum van tijd groeide hij uit tot een van de dragende krachten bij de Rotterdammers, maar volgens de middenvelder zelf zit hij zeker nog niet aan zijn top.

items.title: Cristiano Ronaldo breidt villa-imperium uit op afgelegen plek in Rode Zee
items.summary: Cristiano Ronaldo heeft zichzelf en zijn familie twee uiterst luxe kerstcadeautjes gedaan. De Portugese superster breidde zijn villa-imperium uit op een plek die midden in de Rode Zee ligt, 26 kilometer van de Saoedi-Arabische kustgrens vandaan.

items.title: 'Always hungry, always brave' - why Man City want Semenyo
items.summary: Every transfer window, there is a player whose future becomes the defining saga of the month. This January, it looks set to be Bournemouth's Antoine Semenyo.

items.title: Enticing Salah would be a coup for Saudi league searching for an identity
items.summary: Egypt forward could change face of a league so far mostly reliant on ageing stars and alter perception of football in the Arab world Mohamed Salah has made an impact in Morocco with an injury-time winner to spare Egypt‚Äôs blushes in their Africa Cup of Nations opener against Zimbabwe but his future intervention in Saudi Arabia could be more meaningful. A Saudi Pro League (SPL) that had been moving away from signing big-name veterans is tempted by a player who will be 34 just as this season ends. Although players such as Cristiano Ronaldo and Karim Benzema have been successes on and off the pitch, albeit incredibly expensive ones, the powers that be don‚Äôt want the SPL to be regarded as a retirement league in the sun for stars whose powers are waning. But Salah is different, the attraction intensified by the fact that he is the biggest-name player in the Arab world. Continue reading...

items.title: Rondje Boxing Day: dit maakt de Premier League de beste competitie ter wereld

items.summary: Ajax heeft een studieobject in de aanval. Aan de talkshowtafels werd in 2025 aan geen Eredivisievoetballer zoveel uren besteed als aan selfmade spits Wout Weghorst.

items.title: Martha Stewart becomes latest celebrity to invest in Swansea City FC
items.summary: US lifestyle entrepreneur joins Snoop Dogg and Luka Modric by making minority investment in the Welsh club The American lifestyle personality Martha Stewart has become the latest celebrity to become a co-owner of Swansea City football club. Stewart will join the rapper Snoop Dogg and the footballer Luka Modric as a minority owner of the Welsh club, which plays in the second tier of England‚Äôs football pyramid. The announcement was made in a post on the club‚Äôs website by two of its owners, Brett Cravatt and Jason Cohen. The post did not disclose the size of the investment. Continue reading...

items.title: McIlroy? Littler? Kelly? Norris? Who was 2025's biggest sports star?
items.summary: From Rory McIlroy and Luke Littler, to Lando Norris and Carlos Alcaraz, we look at 15 of the top sporting superstars from 2025.

items.title: VI Kerstnummer 2025: 'Leer te dansen in de regen'
items.summary: Als Rob Jetten binnen afzienbare tijd daadwerkelijk aantreedt als volgende premier van Nederland, zal zijn vader Anton apetrots zijn. Tegelijk zal de grote voetballiefhebber zich altijd blijven afvragen hoe ver de snelle rechtsback van UDI ‚Äô19 het zou hebben geschopt als hij er niet ineens de brui aan had gegeven als B-junior. Een scout van NEC had hem net in het vizier gekregen‚Ä¶ ‚ÄòOf ik hem niet had kunnen overhalen om toch door te gaan met voetballen? Dat hoefde je bij Rob echt niet te proberen.‚Äô

items.title: Arsenal conceding late goals is not a defence issue - it's an attack one
items.summary: Another fright before Christmas. Arsenal never seem to do it the easy way.

items.title: Arsenal survive 'emotionally tough' Palace shootout
items.summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta said it was "emotionally tough" to accept Crystal Palace's stoppage-time equaliser before his team went on to win 8-7 on penalties following a 1-1 draw in their Carabao Cup quarterfinal.

items.title: NWSL OK's 'Rodman rule' even as union objects
items.summary: The NWSL on Tuesday announced the creation of what has been referred to internally as the "High Impact Player" rule (HIP), which would allow teams to spend up to $1 million outside of the salary cap on star players.

items.title: USMNT's Richards stretchered off in Carabao Cup
items.summary: Crystal Palace and United States defender Chris Richards was taken from the field on a stretcher during his team's Carabao Cup game against Arsenal on Tuesday.

items.title: ‚ÄòThis is something he is never going to forget‚Äô: Arsenal stars bring festive joy to Great Ormond Street
items.summary: Bukayo Saka and Gabriel Magalh√£es among those playing games with children, some of whom have been receiving treatment for several years There‚Äôs a buzz going around Great Ormond Street hospital‚Äôs Koala ward. After the England captain, Leah Williamson, and her Arsenal teammate Steph Catley visited the previous week, rumours have been spreading that there could be some more very special guests arriving in the buildup to Christmas. ‚ÄúI think there‚Äôs a little bit of a rumble,‚Äù says Danny Bell, a specialist paediatric physiotherapist in neuro-oncology who works with children recovering from brain tumours. ‚ÄúI can see an Arsenal shirt out there, so that might just be a very big coincidence! They may know the team involved, but I don‚Äôt think they know any individuals. So I‚Äôm really looking forward to seeing their faces as it dawns on them who is going to be here.‚Äù Continue reading...
